owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the `.git` extension. The name is not case sensitive.

ref.description: The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or SHA.

task.description: Specifies a task to execute (e.g., `deploy` or `deploy:migrations`).

auto_merge.description: Attempts to automatically merge the default branch into the requested ref, if it's behind the default branch.

required_contexts.description: The [status](https://docs.github.com/rest/commits/statuses) contexts to verify against commit status checks. If you omit this parameter, GitHub verifies all unique contexts before creating a deployment. To bypass checking entirely, pass an empty array. Defaults to all unique contexts.

environment.description: Name for the target deployment environment (e.g., `production`, `staging`, `qa`).

transient_environment.description: Specifies if the given environment is specific to the deployment and will no longer exist at some point in the future. Default: `false`

production_environment.description: Specifies if the given environment is one that end-users directly interact with. Default: `true` when `environment` is `production` and `false` otherwise.
